meanings.definition: To take care of or look after someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She caretaken her little sister while their parents were at work.
meanings.sent2: The nurse caretaken the patients in the hospital with kindness and compassion.
meanings.sent3: The dog caretaken the toy like it was its own puppy.
meanings.sent4: The gardener caretaken the plants as if they were delicate flowers.
meanings.sent5: He caretaken the injured bird back to health with gentle hands.

meanings.definition: The act of taking care of or looking after someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Her caretaken of the garden showed in the beautiful flowers that bloomed.
meanings.sent2: The caretaken of the elderly in the nursing home was done with love and respect.
meanings.sent3: The cat's caretaken of the mouse was surprisingly gentle.
meanings.sent4: The caretaken of the historic building preserved its beauty for generations to come.
meanings.sent5: The caretaken of the fragile artifact required delicate handling and attention to detail.
